remarks: Approximate division for positive rationals.  This can be thought of as a variation of ~ appdivnq in which ` A ` is zero, although it can be stated and proved in terms of positive rationals alone, without zero as such.  (Contributed by Jim Kingdon, 9-Dec-2019.)
statement:
appdiv0nq $p |- ( ( B e. Q. /\ C e. Q. ) -> E. m e. Q. ( m .Q C ) <Q B ) $.
$d B m $.
$d C m $.
